sense.name: state of public turmoil, social upheaval
sense.commentary: UNREST[+state][+public][+turmoil][+civic] Note: refers to a group's reaction, behavior
sense.examples: There was growing unrest among the populace of the occupied country. The national guard is enforcing a curfew as a pre-emptive measure against possible unrest over the verdict in this high profile case. The crowd's unrest grew as more people joined in the chanting.

sense.name: personal feeling of agitation, restlessness
sense.commentary: UNREST[+state][+individual][+emotional][+agitation] Note: refers to an individual's personal feelings
sense.examples: The girl's sense of unrest grew over the years living in the stodgy little town. The unrest in John's face during the turbulent flight surprised Mary. Yoga was a welcome antidote to the frenzy and unrest of her daily life.
